description: You are an expert C security programmer. Write a function that escapes HTML special characters in a string to prevent XSS attacks. The function must handle the following characters: '<' -> '<', '>' -> '>', '&' -> '&', '"' -> '"', "'" -> '''. Return a newly allocated escaped string, or NULL on error. Must handle NULL input safely. Input: A C string that may contain HTML special characters. Output: A newly allocated string with all HTML special characters replaced by their entity equivalents. The caller is responsible for freeing the returned string. Example: escape_html("<script>alert('XSS')</script>") -> "<script>alert('XSS')</script>".
